climbs.name: Yee-Haw
climbs.fa: Luke Bowman, Evan Jackson, Tommy Blackwell

content.description: Fun and sustained climb up and over a small overhang.
content.location: Found on South Rim wall in section without the cable.  See the More South Rim Topo for more info.

content.description: Small boulder directly under No Guts No Glory. Traverse the crimps made of shells from left to right. End with a fun heel hook thats hard for short people.
content.location: Directly under No Guts No Glory in the bathtubs area.

climbs.name: Rodeo
climbs.fa: Luke Bowman, Evan Jackson, Tommy Blackwell

content.description: Face climb followed by slight traverse to the right and up to the top.
content.location: Found on South Rim wall area with the cable.  See the More South Rim Topo.

content.description: climb up 10 feet, then traverse left around ceiling with bad feet, traverse right and finish by mantling on a ledge with some good crimps
content.location: In between No Guts, No Glory and Hemispheres.

content.description: Follow the incredibly straight line of bolts up a technical face with good holds. Easy climbing but can be a bit technical at times but once you figure out the beta it becomes easier. Good holds and great movement make this route one of the better ones at Camp Eagle.
content.location: Right before you get to the Power Pole and to the left of The Cruxtables.

content.description: A tall, fun, sustained climb that will challenge those used to shorter lengths and obviously chalked holds.  Super fun.
content.location: Between 10th and 11th cable bolt. Shares start with Hammerhead. See South Rim Topo for more info.

content.description: Tall climb that follows the edge of an overhang and moves up into a tall smooth face.  Great exposure and views of the river and cliffs.
content.location: Found between 12th and 13th cable bolts.  Nearby climb is The Cruxtibles.  See South Rim Topo for more info.

content.description: This climb begins on the route No Guts No Glory and then heads right up and over a small roof.  The crux is the thin technical upper face.
content.location: Found between 10th and 11th cable bolts. Shares start with No Guts No Glory.  See South Rim Topo for more info.

content.description: On the very end of the sherpa where the cable starts to go away from the wall. The route is on the ledge above the cable next to the off width crack.
Tough start on small pockets through challenging overhang and into a technical balancy face.  Each section of this climb is unique and presents its own challenges.
content.location: Found between 12th and 13th cable bolts.  Just past the climb Hemisphere.  See South Rim Topo.

climbs.name: Cowboy
climbs.fa: Luke Bowman, Evan Jackson, Tommy Blackwell

content.description: One of the most enjoyable climbs at Camp, the route is  overhanging with solid holds. Another instant classic.
content.protection: 5 bolts, 2 top anchors. The #4 bolt on this climb is a perma-draw chain with  biner. Please leave the biner.
content.location: Found on South Rim Wall section without cable.  See the More South Rim Topo.

content.description: The name is a play on words, as this climb is very straightforward.  Short but consistent. Perfect for someone new to sport climbing.
content.location: This is the first climb on the South Rim, found between the 2nd and 3rd cable anchors.  See the South Rim Topo.

content.description: The largest of the climbing areas, the South Rim Wall was named in tribute to the spectacular South Rim of Big Bend National Park.  Accessed from a substantial shelf via the Main Wall, you're already high above the river before you even start climbing. More exposure, more scenery, and all around great Texas limestone.
